intro: Guatteria leucotricha, commonly known as the white-haired guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its large, simple leaves that are often covered with dense, white pubescence. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its fruit is a fleshy, yellow berry. Guatteria leucotricha plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for various wildlife species.
